page.title: 01General Review - Strensall
page.content: Our block consists of four major elements. These are the{growing {village of Strensall, the Army camp, the edge of{Strensall Common}and the surrounding{farms}with the{River Foss winding its way through the countryside. A great deal of new housing with few additional amenities has appeared in the last ten years. This growth will continue for at least five more years. The Depot, the King's Division is used for training purposes and Strensall Common is M.O.D. property with some access to the general population. Strensall has a{great many new people}due to the camp and new housing. A major problem at this time is trying to integrate everyone into a community. Property changes hands quite quickly and the soldiers families change at least every two years.
